intro: Pleocnemia hemiteliiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pleocnemia, is a rare fern native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in length. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on tree trunks or rocks in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
